file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-44-11-04 - EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the emergency/parking brake handle. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - RE- ALL 32-44-11-000-801-A MOVAL EMERGENCY PARKING BRAKE - INSTAL- ALL 32-44-11-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-44-11 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-44-11-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the emergency/parking brake cables and the handle. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 10-10-01-500-801-A/200 AIRCRAFT NORMAL PARKING AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 710 NLG Bay 123 123BL Controls, rigging door D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Fluorescent Work Light - Explosion To remove the emergency/parking brake Local available 1 Proof - 60 W minimum handle and the cable guards F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Nose Landing Gear Bay, Cockpit and 1 Does the task Maintenance Panel 123BL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the landing gear safety pins are installed ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (2) Put a chock in the landing gear wheels ( AMM TASK 10-10-01-500-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-44-11 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Get access to the nose landing gear bay. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) To remove the emergency/parking brake cable from the emergency/parking brake valve to the turnbuckle, do as follows: (a) Set the emergency/parking brake lever to the released position and attach a DO- NOT-SET-TO-ON tag to it. (b) Remove the locking clips (9) from the turnbuckle (7) and discard them. (c) Disconnect the turnbuckle (7) from the control cable (8). (d) Remove the cotter pin (1) from the brake valve (2) sector to release the cable; discard the cotter pins. (e) Remove the control cable from the sector of the brake valve. (2) To remove the emergency/parking brake cable from the emergency/parking brake handle to the turnbuckle, do as follows: (a) Remove the bolts (4) and washers (5) from the plate (6) and the gasket (3). (b) Remove the pressure seal. (c) Get access to the maintenance panel 123BL. (d) Remove the two cable guards from the control cables driving pulleys. Refer to Figure 401. (e) Release the bolts (1) of the emergency/parking brake handle panel (4). Refer to Figure 402. (f) Remove the emergency/parking brake handle panel from the console. Refer to Figure 402. (g) For aircraft with cockpit map pouch, remove it from the console. (h) Remove the screws (3) from panel 223SZ. Refer to Figure 402. (i) Remove panel 223SZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100) from the console. Refer to Figure 402. (j) Remove the bolt (7) that attaches the emergency/parking brake to the console structure. (k) Remove the bolts (5) that attaches the emergency/parking brake base to the console. (l) Remove the emergency/parking brake base (6) and the cable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-44-11 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE PANEL 5. BOLT (4) 6. BASE 7. BOLT (1) DET. B 145AMM320516.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-44-11 Page 5 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-44-11-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. EMERGENCY PARKING BRAKE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the emergency parking brake circuit cables and the handle. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 32-44-11/500 - ADJUSTMENT/TEST AMM TASK 10-10-01-500-801-A/200 AIRCRAFT NORMAL PARKING AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 32-44-11-000-801-A/400 EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - REMOVAL IPC 32-44-00 EMERGENCY PARKING BRAKE SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 710 NLG Bay 123 123BL Controls, rigging door D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Fluorescent Work Light - Explosion To remove the emergency/parking brake Local available 1 Proof - 60 W minimum handle and the cable guards F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Locking clip IPC 32-44-00 2 Cotter pin IPC 32-44-00 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-44-11 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Nose Landing Gear Bay, Cockpit and 1 Does the task Maintenance Panel 123BL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is in the same configuration as it was at the end of the removal (AMM TASK 32-44-11-000-801-A/400) task. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) To install the emergency/parking brake cable from the emergency/parking brake valve to the turnbuckle, do as follows: (a) Install the control cable in the brake valve sector. (b) Install a new cotter pin (1) in the brake valve (2) sector to attach the cable. (c) Connect the turnbuckle (7) to the control cable (8). (d) Do the adjustment and test of the emergency/parking brake (AMM MPP 32-44-11/500). (e) Install new locking clips (9) on the turnbuckle (7). (2) To install the emergency/parking brake cable from the emergency/parking brake handle to the turnbuckle, do as follows: (a) Put the emergency/parking brake base (6) and the cable in position. (b) Install the two cable guards at the control cables driving pulleys. Refer to Figure 401. (c) Install the bolts (5) that attach the emergency/parking brake base (6) to the console. (d) Install the bolt (7) that attach the emergency/parking brake to the console structure. (e) Install panel 223SZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100) to the console. (f) Install the screws (3) in panel 223SZ. (g) For aircraft with cockpit map pouch, install it to the console. (h) Put the emergency/parking brake handle panel (4) in position on the console. (i) Install the bolts (1) that attach the emergency/parking brake handle panel. (j) Install the pressure seal. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-44-11 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (k) Install the bolts (4) and washers (5) in the plates (6) and the gasket (3). (l) Connect the turnbuckle (7) to the control cable. Refer to Figure 401. (m) Do the adjustment and test of the emergency/parking brake (AMM MPP 32-44-11/500). (n) Install new locking clips (9) in the turnbuckle. Refer to Figure 401. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the landing gear safety pins ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (2) Remove the chock from the landing gear wheels ( AMM TASK 10-10-01-500-801-A/ 200). (3) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the emergency/parking brake lever. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-44-11 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
